filmography.title: The Farmer Takes a Wife
filmography.role_description: A quiet, determined farmer working on the Erie Canal who falls in love with a canal boat cook in his screen debut.
filmography.plot: A farmer works on the Erie Canal to earn money to buy a farm, but falls for a woman who loves the canal life.

filmography.title: The Trail of the Lonesome Pine
filmography.role_description: A rugged mountain man involved in a bitter family feud who clashes with an engineer bringing the railroad to their remote home.
filmography.plot: A family feud in the Blue Ridge Mountains is exacerbated by the arrival of a railroad engineer and the romance that ensues.

filmography.title: You Only Live Once
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict trying to go straight who is framed for a bank robbery and forced to go on the run with his loyal wife.
filmography.plot: A quiet man with a criminal past is framed for murder and forced to flee with his wife, becoming a 'Bonnie and Clyde' style duo.

filmography.title: Jezebel
filmography.role_description: A principled Southern banker who breaks his engagement with a headstrong belle due to her scandalous behavior, only to face her attempts to win him back.
filmography.plot: A willful Southern belle defies societal rules and loses her fiancé, only to try and redeem herself when a yellow fever epidemic strikes.

filmography.title: Young Mr. Lincoln
filmography.role_description: The future president as a young, idealistic lawyer in Illinois who defends two brothers accused of murder in a pivotal court case.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized account of the early life of Abraham Lincoln as a young lawyer facing his first major court case.

filmography.title: Drums Along the Mohawk
filmography.role_description: A colonial settler in the Mohawk Valley who must protect his farm and pregnant wife from British and Native American attacks during the Revolutionary War.
filmography.plot: Newlyweds try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but face the menace of Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

filmography.title: The Grapes of Wrath
filmography.role_description: A paroled convict who becomes the moral center of his displaced family as they migrate from the Dust Bowl of Oklahoma to California.
filmography.plot: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land during the Great Depression and travels to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless.

filmography.title: The Lady Eve
filmography.role_description: A naive, wealthy ophidiologist (snake expert) who becomes the target of a beautiful con artist on an ocean liner.
filmography.plot: A trio of classy card sharks targets a socially awkward heir on an ocean liner, but the plan is complicated when the female lead falls in love.

filmography.title: The Male Animal
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered college professor who takes a stand for free speech by reading a controversial letter to his class, risking his job.
filmography.plot: A college professor's life is complicated by the return of his wife's former football star boyfriend and a debate over academic freedom.

filmography.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
filmography.role_description: A wandering cowboy who becomes a reluctant witness to a lynch mob's rush to judgment against three innocent men.
filmography.plot: Two drifters are passing through a Western town when news comes in that a local rancher has been murdered and his cattle stolen.

filmography.title: My Darling Clementine
filmography.role_description: The legendary lawman who accepts the job of town marshal in Tombstone to avenge his brother's murder by the Clanton gang.
filmography.plot: Wyatt Earp and his brothers arrive in Tombstone, Arizona, where they run afoul of the Clanton gang and Wyatt falls for the Doc Holliday's former lover.

filmography.title: Fort Apache
filmography.role_description: An arrogant and by-the-book cavalry officer who resents his posting to a remote fort and disastrously underestimates his Apache adversaries.
filmography.plot: At a remote cavalry post, a strict and arrogant commander clashes with his troops and leads them into a disastrous confrontation with the Apaches.
filmography.awards: Locarno International Film Festival: Win – Best Director

filmography.title: Mister Roberts
filmography.role_description: A well-liked cargo ship officer who yearns for combat duty but is kept on board by a petty, tyrannical captain to manage the crew.
filmography.plot: In the waning days of World War II, a cargo ship officer battles his tyrannical captain while trying to get a transfer to combat duty.

filmography.title: War and Peace
filmography.role_description: A gentle, awkward Russian count who inherits a fortune and searches for the meaning of life amidst the Napoleonic Wars.
filmography.plot: Napoleon's tumultuous relations with Russia including his disastrous 1812 invasion serve as the backdrop for the tangled personal lives of two aristocratic families.

filmography.title: The Wrong Man
filmography.role_description: A musician at the Stork Club who is falsely accused of a string of robberies, leading to a harrowing legal nightmare.
filmography.plot: In 1953, an innocent man is mistaken for an armed robber and caught up in the criminal justice system with spiraling consequences.

filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: A thoughtful and principled juror who stands alone against eleven others to prevent a rush to judgment in a capital murder case.
filmography.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture (Producer); BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: The Tin Star
filmography.role_description: A cynical former sheriff turned bounty hunter who mentors a young, inexperienced lawman in a dangerous town.
filmography.plot: An experienced bounty hunter takes a young, inexperienced sheriff under his wing and teaches him the ways of the West.

filmography.title: Warlock
filmography.role_description: A famous gunslinger hired by a town to restore order, but whose presence brings its own complications and moral ambiguity.
filmography.plot: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's reign of terror, but his methods spark a conflict with his former deputy.

filmography.title: Advise & Consent
filmography.role_description: A controversial nominee for Secretary of State whose confirmation hearing exposes deep political secrets and blackmail.
filmography.plot: Senate investigation into the President's newly nominated Secretary of State gives light to a secret from the past, which may not only ruin the candidate, but the President's character as well.

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: The arthritis-stricken general who insists on landing with his troops on Utah Beach during the D-Day invasion.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A rugged buffalo hunter who tries to maintain peace with the Native Americans while guiding the railroad construction crews.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: Fail Safe
filmography.role_description: The President of the United States who must make a terrifying decision to prevent total global annihilation after an accidental nuclear attack is launched.
filmography.plot: A technical failure allows an American nuclear attack bomber to proceed past its fail-safe point, forcing the President to make a desperate deal with the Soviets.

filmography.title: The Best Man
filmography.role_description: A principled but indecisive presidential candidate who struggles with whether to use dirt on his opponent to secure the nomination.
filmography.plot: Two candidates vying for their party's presidential nomination during the primary season battle for the endorsement of the dying former President.

filmography.title: Welcome to Hard Times
filmography.role_description: A cowardly mayor of a dying town who fails to stop a bandit, then tries to rebuild the town and his own courage.
filmography.plot: A stranger terrorizes a small settlement and kills the founder, leaving the weak-willed mayor to deal with the aftermath and the killer's eventual return.

filmography.title: Yours, Mine and Ours
filmography.role_description: A widowed Navy warrant officer with ten children who marries a widow with eight children, creating a chaotic, massive family.
filmography.plot: A widower with ten children marries a widow with eight, and the twenty of them try to come together as one big, happy family.

filmography.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
filmography.role_description: A cold-blooded, blue-eyed hired killer working for a railroad tycoon, representing the ruthless march of progress in the West.
filmography.plot: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

filmography.title: Sometimes a Great Notion
filmography.role_description: The stubborn patriarch of a family of independent loggers in Oregon who refuses to join a union strike.
filmography.plot: A family of fiercely independent Oregon loggers struggle to keep the family business alive amidst changing times and a local strike.

filmography.title: Midway
filmography.role_description: The Commander-in-Chief of the US Pacific Fleet who masterminds the strategy for the decisive Battle of Midway.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the battle that was a turning point in the Pacific Theater of World War II.

filmography.title: On Golden Pond
filmography.role_description: A curmudgeonly retired professor grappling with memory loss and mortality who attempts to reconcile with his estranged daughter during a summer at his lake house.
filmography.plot: Norman is a curmudgeon with an estranged relationship with his daughter Chelsea. At Golden Pond, he and his wife agree to care for Billy, the son of Chelsea's new boyfriend, and a most unexpected relationship blooms.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)
